meanings.definition: A person who signs or gives approval to a document or product.
meanings.sent1: The endorsor of the contract was happy with the terms.
meanings.sent2: The endorsor of the petition helped make it official.
meanings.sent3: The endorsor of the recipe book was the famous chef himself.
meanings.sent4: She was the endorsor of good taste, always choosing the best products.
meanings.sent5: The endorsor of the painting added value to it with their signature.

meanings.definition: To sign the back of a check or other financial instrument to transfer ownership.
meanings.sent1: Please endorsor the check before depositing it.
meanings.sent2: He quickly endorsored the document and handed it over.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to endorsor the toy mouse with its paw.
meanings.sent4: She endorsored the contract with a flourish, sealing the deal.
meanings.sent5: The teacher endorsored the student's hard work with a gold star.

meanings.definition: To publicly support or promote a product or service.
meanings.sent1: The company asked her to endorsor their new product.
meanings.sent2: He endorsored the charity event by attending and donating.
meanings.sent3: The dog tried to endorsor the new dog food by wagging its tail.
meanings.sent4: She endorsored the local business by recommending it to her friends.
meanings.sent5: The celebrity endorsored the clothing line, making it popular among fans.
